_header: Here are nine points of great virtue
Note:
For prose versions see Oxford, Bodleian Library Eng. poet. a.1 (SC 3938) [Vernon MS]; Oxford, Bodleian Library Rawlinson C.285 (SC 12143), f. 52, with rhymes; London, British Library Harley 1704, f. 48v; London, British Library Harley 1706, pr. Horstmann (1895)
XHorstmann, Carl. Yorkshire Writers. 2 vols. London, Sonnenschein; New York: Macmillan, 1895-96, 1.110-11; and for a Latin text see Cambridge UK, Gonville & Caius College 140/80, f. 132. For another text which begins with a short preface see 375.
_description: Novem Virtutes — 114 lines in couplets with Latin interpolations

BodRawPoe34.First Lines:
Her be ix poyntes of gret vertuThat owr told swet
                    ihesu…
BodRawPoe34.Last Lines:
…þat ys erthly mor than meThat by com man and dyed for
                    the

CULFf114.First Lines:
Her er ix poyntes of gret vertuþat our Lord cald swete
                    ihesu…
CULFf114.Last Lines:
…þat is here hartly more þan meþat become man
                    and dyede for þe
CULFf114.Attributed Title:
Nouem virtutes (f. 5); Expliciunt nouem virtutes (f. 7, Latin
                    portion ends)

CULIi49.First Lines:
Here bethe ix poynltys of gret vertuThat oure lorde tolde swete
                    Ihesu…
CULIi49.Last Lines:
…That is hertyly me more then meThat be com ma
                    & deyd for the Amen
